unnormalised: Vaishno Devi Yatra Sees Surge in Devotees; New Guidelines Issued.
normalised: Vaishno Devi Yatra Sees Surge in Devotees; New Guidelines Issued.

unnormalised: The Vaishno Devi Yatra is experiencing a massive rush this year, especially with the Navratri season around the corner. Sources report a 25% increase in pilgrims compared to last yr, with daily footfall exceeding 40,000. The Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board (SMVDSB) has preponed the implementation of new crowd management measures to ensure the safety and convenience of all devotees. The expected increase in pilgrims has officials scrambling to prep for the influx and ensure a smooth and safe experience for everyone. The Yatra is a big deal for many, and folks are excited to visit.
normalised: The Vaishno Devi Yatra is experiencing a massive rush this year, especially with the Navratri season around the corner. Sources report a twenty five percent increase in pilgrims compared to last year, with daily footfall exceeding forty thousand. The S-M-V-D-S-B has preponed the implementation of new crowd management measures to ensure the safety and convenience of all devotees. The expected increase in pilgrims has officials scrambling to prep for the influx and ensure a smooth and safe experience for everyone. The Yatra is a big deal for many, and folks are excited to visit.

unnormalised: These measures include a revised registration process, with online booking now mandatory at least 24 hrs before arrival in Katra. Also, the SMVDSB is issuing only 35,000 RFID cards per day to better track and manage pilgrim movement along the 12 km trek to the Bhawan. This comes after some reported incidents of overcrowding in the past, and aims to avoid any unpleasantness. Pilgrims are advised to book accommodations and helicopter services in advance through the official website to avoid last-minute hassles. Plus, keep an eye out for weather advisories as the monsoon season can still bring unexpected showers up in the hills.
normalised: These measures include a revised registration process, with online booking now mandatory at least twenty four hours before arrival in Katra. Also, the S-M-V-D-S-B is issuing only thirty five thousand R-F-I-D cards per day to better track and manage pilgrim movement along the twelve kilometer trek to the Bhawan. This comes after some reported incidents of overcrowding in the past, and aims to avoid any unpleasantness. Pilgrims are advised to book accommodations and helicopter services in advance through the official website to avoid last-minute hassles. Plus, keep an eye out for weather advisories as the monsoon season can still bring unexpected showers up in the hills.

unnormalised: According to sources, the board is also planning to introduce more battery-operated vehicles along the route for elderly and differently-abled pilgrims. Local businesses in Katra, heavily reliant on tourism, are gearing up for a busy season, with hotels and restaurants expecting full occupancy until Diwali. Prices for ‘prasad’ have remained stable at Rs. 50 per packet. Let's hope everyone has a safe and fulfilling pilgrimage!
